name: Lydstep Cliffs and Caverns Walk, Stackpole

ai.summary: A short, easy coastal walk of 3.9 km near Stackpole, featuring cliff-top views and accessible sea caves. Suitable for most walkers with time for photo stops and a quick cave explore if conditions allow.
ai.terrain_summary: Coastal path with cliff-top sections, gentle ascents and descents, some stairs and uneven ground. Exposed edges, rocky patches near sea caves, and potentially slippery footing when wet. Weather can change quickly; plan around tides if exploring coastal coves.
ai.safety_notes: Stay away from unstable cliff edges and do not approach the sea during high tides or rough seas. Stay on marked paths; beware of sudden waves and slippery rocks near coves. Wear sturdy footwear and weather-appropriate clothing. Check tide times and daylight; bring a light source if exploring caverns, as they can be dark. Mobile signals may be limited; carry a map and tell someone your route.
recommended_gear: Fully charged mobile phone; portable charger
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) for milder weather and clearer sea views; winters can be windy and wet.

seo.title: Lydstep Cliffs and Caverns Walk, Stackpole – Easy 3.9 km Coastal Hike in the UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the easy 3.9 km Lydstep Cliffs and Caverns Walk at Stackpole, a coastal route with cliff-top vistas and sea caves. Safety tips, gear, and best seasons.
